review_blob: 2014 from bottle. Stored in walk-in cooler. Pours a very fluffy light brown head, reminiscent of a Coca Cola, that quickly dissipates into a syrupy, still, fructose sugar bomb. Ginger and spice are there but not in a good way. It seems time has not been kind to this beer. Mouth feel is quite sticky and leaning to the medicinal. Not getting any of the oatmeal viscosity. Kind of a let down. Dark Star series is usually a winner but you cant hit it out of the park every time.
beer_name: Fremont Dark Star - Bourbon Barrel Spice Wars

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob:
Bottle from 2013. Aroma is vanilla, sharp, wood, carmel.
Taste is sweet maple, cinnamon, no burn, dry finish.
beer_name: Hair of the Dog Bourbon Fred from the Wood

review_blob:
Peat aroma builds in the aroma. Sour dough bread. 
Taste is sour, vanilla, cherry, peat but not too much, just the right amount. Apple cider. Bitterness is similar to chewing on the but of a dry cigar. 
This beer has so many layers to explore. Take your time with it.
beer_name: Brau Brothers Bancreagie 26 Peated Sour Ale

review_blob: Bottle from 2011. Dank, pepper, jalapeo? Light mouthfeel, sharp and spicy. Pear. Sour and dry. Lemons balls. Great Gueuze!

Very interesting nose. Sour smell. Slight smoked malts comes through. 
Tast is dark cherries, sweet, quick flash of tart then changes to a rough chewy mouthfeel.
beer_name: Wicked Weed Black Angel Cherry Sour

review_blob: Bottle from 2011. Very malty! Carmel, syrup, maple, dark fruit. Little sips.

Aroma is wafting marijuana and citrus.
Citrus sour, nice carbonation that brings a slight lime taste.
Mango, lime, spice, peaches, acetic barnyard funkiness is apparent in the aftertaste and leads to a rich, silky finish. Delicious. Need to try the sour.

Aroma is plums, confectionary sugar, molasses, raisins, 
Very light bodied, cinnamon, vanilla, smoke.
Very nice body to sweetness balance. A really nice barley wine!

Aroma is peach, mikan, sweet, a bit of funk. A bit a vallina.
Light bodied but with a more than a bit of carbonation. 
Very smoky, like a rauch, ham. Very complex. Strong smokey taste but not so much so that its undrinkable.
beer_name: Stone Matts Burning Rosids Imperial Cherry Wood Smoked Saison

review_blob:
Aroma is strong grape juice concentrate. 
Taste is sweet. Very sweet.
Grape juice. Sweet. Plums. 
Simple beer.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob:
Aroma is mandarin oranges, very mild funk, brett is definitely present, sour.
Taste is med to heavy, surprising for this kind of beer. Thick sweetness due to the light carbonation, lemon lime. Wood. Very limey. Grapefruit.
I would like to lay this down for 8 to 12 months. This could be really fun if the lemon lime edge was rounded out a bit.

Smells grapes, lemons, plum skins.
Taste sweet, then goes sour. Lots going on in the aftertaste. 
Belgian yeastiness, a little bready, med bodied, coats your tough with a pleasant estuary taste. Rich. A bit of metallic ting but not in a bad way, more of in a roasty vienna malts way. Taste old school. Gonna be going back to this one a few more times. Heaps going on here.

Pours a light pink, light lacing. 
Smells grapefruit, citrus, cranberries. 
Light bodied. Mouth feel is like a rose wine with pears. 
Its a bit too light. Finish is really fleeting. Not a bad beer but not what I was hoping for.

bitter sweet, med bodied, bit of a soapy mouth feel, but not all that bad. Caramel malts leads nicely into the Hallertauer hops. Short citrusy punch at the end. Aftertaste is honey and caramel. Not a bad beer, but not great. Would be really nice on a hot spring day.

Bottle and aged about a year. 
Aroma is sweet raisins. 
Light bodied. Coffee and very light vanilla. Liquid smoke. Mocha. 
Something more there but can find it. 
Would like to try this on tap.

Bottle 2012
Thick, rich, creamy head.
Deep bready yeasty Aroma. 
Surprisingly light bodied! A little chalky.
Plum crossing into soy, smoke, a bit of heat. Mesquite. Caramelized cherries are hiding deep in the heat. 
Is that beef jerky? 
A very fun bottle!

Bottle 2013.
Bright pink, grape head. 
Peach, grape, cherries, a little funk, Mandarin orange juice in the can. 
Taste is very tart, no sweetness. Bitterness is from the stem. Needs more time to bring the tartness down. 
A good beer, would like to try earlier batches.

Aroma is cherries and basement funk. A little tea.
light sweetness, medium sourness.
light body, sticky, sweet ketchup.

Aroma is plums and raisins. 
Ashy and chalky then nothing. No flavor other than salt or soy. Is this an off bottle or is the beer actually this bland?
beer_name: BrewDog / Ballast Point San Diego Scotch Ale

review_blob:
Bottled cellared for about half a year.
Aroma is crab apples, plastic, lots of funk!
Sour! Rotten strawberries in a barn. Very complex. Sour green apple talfy. 
Dry

Dark brown, red. Small tight head that congregates quickly around the edge of glass.
Aroma is plum, brown sugar, booze.
Med to heavy body, raisins, caramelized brown sugar, hot and boozy finish that creeps back up your throat. Red licorice and cough medicine.

Big bubbles, very little carbonation when agitated. Black.
A bit of a cereal smell. Dough and yeast.
Sweet, boozy, hot, very light body. Would be great with some chilli in there! Sweetness on the front, but very smokey and boozy in the finish.
No character in the body. Dont like the way it sits in my mouth. Like stout mouthwash. 
A good beer with lots of char. I would by more if I could.

Bottle, cellared 1.5 years.
Big, creamy, fluffy, thick deep brown head. Very dark beer. Smell is crisp, clean, vanilla, chocolate.
Very soft and silky mouthfeel. Nothing overly going on at all. Cellaring really took all the sharp edges off. Soy, umami, chocolate, doughy, marshmallows.
Gets some smoke as it warms up. Not bad but prob not worth cellaring.

Aroma pete! 
Taste is ashy, chalky, wood chips, dry, small vanilla.
Not a well balanced beer. I dont taste 11.5% at all. Not what I was expecting at all.

Bottle - Sniffer glass

Fluffy big head. Very dark purple red color.
Smell is cough medicine, white pepper, vanilla extract, sweet.
Taste is caramelized black licorice, bitter, raw vanilla. Finish leaves a sticky sweet bitterness that clings to the sides of your cheeks. Light bodied and very drinkable. Texture is rough like an ESB but is balanced out by the vanilla. Smoke is there but not overdone; just enough to add something to the vanilla.
Great beer. Enjoy more with each sip. Lots of great pairing possibilities.

Pours a light brown head.
Aroma is IPA like. Fresh water. Grassy.
Mouthfeel is light bodied with very subtle roasted notes. 
There is a lot going on in this beer.

Bottle from Nagano Trading drank from a tulip glass.
Nice tight light brown head that stays strong.
Aroma is caramel, citrus, leaves, a bit of plums, some raisins, vanilla, dough and orange peel.
Very grainy mouthfeel. Nice dry, chalky rye taste. Sweet and flavorful. 
Very drinkable.

Aroma is grassy and dopey. Smells like a brewery. 
Light body, strange bitter sweet aftertaste. 
A pretty good beer from Kirin. Better than there, The Hops release.

Release #9
Coffee and cocoa aroma.
Bitter, vanilla. A full bodied Coffee Bender. 
Mouthfeel is a bit creamy and sweet on the finish. 
Really good. Great desert beer.

Batch #498 bottle
Smokey aroma.
Roasted coffee. raisins and plums. Dirt, earth, cherries? 
Good stuff.

2012 ver. Bottle.
Smells whip cream. Milk. Butter on fruit cake.
Very boozy but not as strong as when it first came out last year. One year on it has taken a lot of the sharp alcohol taste off it; still a bit of heat. Great mouthfeel. Creamy and thick.

2008 ver.
Aroma is woody, funky, carmel, cabin smell. musty. 
Taste is leathery, sweet, spicy, porty and warm. Boozy. 
Some heat. Fireside.

Bottled Nov 2013.
Very young. Brett comes off as very metallic. Light, spicy and sweet. Needs a few more years on it. Good but need to wait.

Aroma is same as any other Rodenbach.
Very nice carbonation. Very sour, nice mouthfeel. Would like to taste this on a vertical tasting.

2013 ver.
Smells like sticky pot. Changes to orange peals as it warms up.
Thick and malty- med bodied. Not as complex as 2012 ver. Good and easy to drink.

From the bottle.
Smells like mandarin oranges.
Starts zesty then turns a touch sour but leaves a very malty, calkey taste.

2007 ver.
Long pour into the glass produced a bit of head.
Licorice, port, molasses aroma.
Amazing mouth feel! There is heat but no burn. Very soft and subtle. Velvety sweetness that zaps the sides of your mouth and leaves your mouth watering. Amazing!

Smells clean, very sour smell. Cranberries.
Tight off white head stays present around the sides. 
Very sour! Clean and fruity start with a sour kick to the side of the tongue. Crisp. Funky. Leather. Sour. 
A really good sour beer.

Smell of opening a can of olives. 
Very thick mouth feel. Sugary, brown sugar, almost grainy sugar.

Light orange color, tight lacing around edge. 
Smell of Citra, orange peel, orange jello. 
Raw, bitter hops, sticky resin, acidic.

Aroma is strong spice. Smells like a can of pumpkin puree. Cough medicine taste, snappy mouth feel. 
Sweet hard candy aftertaste. Not all bad for a pumpkin beer.

Smell is pepper, pears, pickles.
Pours a big head.
Taste is peppers, beats, little vinegar, drinking a salad. Pickley. Green veggies. Orange.

Cake frosting aroma.
This is mild desert beer. Would be great with a wet fudge brownie with lots of whip cream on top, with a small scoop of Italian vanilla ice cream. 
There is some mellon in there. Honey, little orange but not citrusy.

2011 vintage.
Poured a dark mahogany color.
Smells of light cinnamon. 
Plums, raisins, caramel and oak. Very well balanced.

Cabbage and green vegetables smell.
Vibrant front, metallic. Smokey finish.

Smells of honey. Light.
Tastes of Chinese medicine, watered down honey, Finishes with a taste that is Japanese arajio (a kind of salt that goes on red rice). 
Very fun beer. Totally different.

Smelled of a water, clean sewer. Not rotten, but clean funk.
Taste was oiled cabbage, blue berries, runny, sea salt, briney, vegetable.
Saison funky sourness with vegetable brine.

Poured a light golden head.
Smelled of grapes or muscat.
Taste is creamy, bready, fruity.

Pours orange red.
Smells sour and tart!
Taste is yogurt creamy sweet, then bang! sour, very sour for a saison! Messy tartness, old style, oak. If you can get past the tartness there is a lot more going on here.

2006 vintage. 
Poured light brown with small, tight bubbles.
Smell is malty, sweet sugar. Not burnt but caramelized.
Taste is licorice, full bodied, smooth, boozy with no burn. Clean, smooth finish. Fun beer to sip.
